abstract: Microsoft is starting its drive into the consumer health care market by offering free health records on the Web.
snippet: Microsoft is starting its drive into the consumer health care market by offering free health records on the Web.
lead_paragraph: Microsoft is starting its long-anticipated drive into the consumer health care market by offering free personal health records on the Web and pursuing a strategy that borrows from the company’s successful formula in personal computer software.

headline.main: Microsoft Rolls Out Personal Health Records
headline.print_headline: Microsoft Rolls Out Personal Health Records

abstract: Thousands of software developers are creating features for Facebook, the fast-growing social network, many hoping to strike it rich alongside Facebook’s own employees.
snippet: Thousands of software developers are creating features for Facebook, the fast-growing social network, many hoping to strike it rich alongside Facebook’s own employees.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO, Oct. 3 — The Facebook frenzy is spreading.

headline.main: In Facebook, Investing in a Theory
headline.print_headline: In Facebook, Investing In a Theory

abstract: In an interview, Bill Gates expressed surprise that the music industry had failed to turn digital music into a big moneymaker.
snippet: In an interview, Bill Gates expressed surprise that the music industry had failed to turn digital music into a big moneymaker.
lead_paragraph: REDMOND, Wash., Oct. 2 — Even Bill Gates might admit that some of the ways he discovers new music could be regarded as quaint in the digital era: he has favored the folk-inflected soundtrack from the film “Once” after seeing the movie recently, and he learned about Kelly Clarkson not from watching “American Idol,” but from his 11-year-old daughter.

headline.main: As for Music, Gates’s Taste May Not Be Adventurous but His Strategies Are
headline.print_headline: As for Music, Gates’s Taste May Not Be Adventurous but His Strategies Are
